text: Thus says Yahweh:
“Look, I \add am\add* going to stir up against Babylon
and against the inhabitants of Leb-qamai a destructive wind.
And I will send winnowers to Babylon,
and they will winnow her,
and they will lay waste her land,
for they will be against her from all sides on \add the\add* day of disaster.
Let not him who bends the bow shoot his bow,
and let him not rise high in his body armor.
And you must not spare her young men;
destroy her whole army.
And they will fall slain in the land of \add the\add* Chaldeans,
and pierced through in her streets.
For neither Israel nor Judah \add is\add* a widower from their God,
from Yahweh of hosts,
though their land is full of guilt
against the Holy One of Israel.”
Flee from the midst of Babylon and save each one his life.
You must not perish because of her guilt.
For this \add is the\add* time of vengeance for Yahweh,
he \add will\add* repay her what is deserved.
Babylon \add was\add* a cup of gold in the hand of Yahweh,
making drunk all the earth.
\add The\add* nations drank of her wine.
⸤Therefore⸥\f + \fr 51:7 \ft Literally “Unto thus” \f* \add the\add* nations acted like madmen.
Suddenly Babylon has fallen and she is shattered.
Wail over her!
Take balm for her wounds,
perhaps she may be healed.
We tried to heal Babylon, and she was not healed.
Forsake her and let us go each one to his country,
for her judgment has reached to the heavens,
and it has been lifted up to \add the\add* skies.
Yahweh has brought forth our vindication.
Come and let us make known in Zion the work of Yahweh our God.
Sharpen the arrows, fill the quivers!
Yahweh has stirred up the spirit of the kings of the Medes.
Because his plan concerning Babylon \add is\add* to destroy it,
for that is the vengeance of Yahweh,
the vengeance for his temple.
Against the walls of Babylon raise a banner;
⸤post a strong watch⸥,\f + \fr 51:12 \ft Literally “make strong the guard” \f* post watchmen, prepare the ambushes,
for Yahweh has both planned as well as performed
what he has spoken concerning the inhabitants of Babylon.
\add O you who\add* live by mighty waters, rich in treasures,
your end has come, ⸤the measure of your life⸥.\f + \fr 51:13 \ft Literally “the cubit of your severing” \f*
Yahweh of hosts has sworn by himself,
“Surely I will fill you \add with\add* troops like the creeping locusts,\f + \fr 51:14 \ft Hebrew “locust” \f*
and they will sing over you a war cry.”
\add He is the one who\add* made \add the\add* earth by his power,
\add the one who\add* created \add the\add* world by his wisdom,
and by his understanding he stretched out \add the\add* heavens.
At the giving of his voice
\add there is\add* a roar of waters in the heavens,
and he causes \add the\add* patches of mist
to go up from \add the\add* end of \add the\add* earth.
He makes lightning for the rain,
and he brings out \add the\add* wind from his storehouses.
All humankind turns out to be stupid,
without knowledge.
Every goldsmith is put to shame
by \add the\add* divine image.
For his cast image \add is\add* a lie,
and \add there is\add* no breath in them.
They \add are\add* worthless,
a work of mockery.
At the time of their punishment,
they will perish.
The portion of Jacob \add is\add* not like these,
for he \add is\add* the creator of ⸤everything⸥,\f + \fr 51:19 \ft Literally “the all” \f*
and the tribe of his inheritance.
Yahweh of hosts \add is\add* his name.
\add He says\add*, “You \add are\add* a war club for me,
a weapon of battle,
and I smash nations with you,
and I destroy kingdoms with you.
And I smash \add the\add* horse with you,
and its rider,
and I smash \add the\add* chariot with you,
and its rider.
And I smash man and woman with you,
and I smash \add the\add* old man and \add the\add* boy with you,
and I smash \add the\add* young man and \add the\add* young woman with you.
And I smash \add the\add* shepherd and his flock with you,
and I smash \add the\add* farmer and his team with you,
and I smash \add the\add* governors and \add the\add* officials with you.
And I will repay Babylon,
and all the inhabitants of Chaldea,
all their wickedness that they have done in Zion
before your eyes,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 51:24 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh.
“Look, I \add am\add* against you,
O mountain of the destruction,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 51:25 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh,
“the \add one\add* that destroys the whole earth.
And I will stretch out my hand against you,
and I will roll you down from the cliffs,
and I will make you as a mountain burned away.
They will not take from you
a stone for a corner,
and a stone for a foundation,
for you will be ⸤an everlasting desolation⸥,”\f + \fr 51:26 \ft Literally “a desolation of everlasting” \f* ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 51:26 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh.
Raise a banner in the land;
blow a horn among the nations;
prepare for holy war against her;
summon \add the\add* nations against her,
the kingdoms of Ararat, Minni, and Ashkenaz;
summon against her an official;
bring up horses\f + \fr 51:27 \ft Hebrew “horse” \f* like bristling creeping locusts.\f + \fr 51:27 \ft Hebrew “locust” \f*
Prepare \add the\add* nations for holy war against her,
the kings of the Medes,
with their governors and all their officials,
and every land of their dominion.
And the land quakes and writhes,
for the plans of Yahweh against Babylon stand,
to make the land of Babylon as a horror,
⸤without⸥\f + \fr 51:29 \ft Literally “from there is not” \f* inhabitant.
The warriors of Babylon have ceased to fight,
they remain in the strongholds,
their power has dried up,
they have become as women.
Her dwelling places are set on fire,
her bars are broken.
\add one\add* runner runs to meet \add another\add* runner,
and \add one\add* messenger to meet \add another\add* messenger,
to tell the king of Babylon that his city has been captured,
⸤from end to end⸥.\f + \fr 51:31 \ft Literally “from end” \f*
And the fords have been seized,
and the reed marshes have been burned with fire,
and ⸤the soldiers⸥\f + \fr 51:32 \ft Literally “the men of the war” \f* are horrified.
For thus says Yahweh of hosts, the God of Israel,
“The daughter of Babylon \add is\add* like a threshing floor
\add at the\add* time it \add is\add* trodden down,
⸤just a little while⸥\f + \fr 51:33 \ft Literally “still a little” \f*
and the time of the harvest will come for her.”
Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon
has devoured me \add and\add* sucked me dry;
he has made me an empty vessel;
he has swallowed me like the sea monster;
he has filled his belly with my delicacies;
he has rinsed me.
“\add May\add* the violence done to me and to my flesh \add be\add* on Babylon,”
the inhabitants\f + \fr 51:35 \ft Hebrew “inhabitant” \f* of Zion will say;
and “My blood \add be\add* upon the inhabitants of Chaldea,”
Jerusalem will say.
⸤Therefore⸥\f + \fr 51:36 \ft Literally “To thus” \f* thus says Yahweh,
“Look, I \add am\add* going to contend your case,
and I will avenge your vengeance,
and I will cause her sea to dry up,
and I will cause her fountain to dry up.
And Babylon will become as a heap of stones,
a lair of jackals,
\add an object of\add* horror, and \add an object of\add* hissing,
⸤without⸥\f + \fr 51:37 \ft Literally “from there is not” \f* inhabitants.
They will roar together like the young lions,
they will growl like the cubs of lions.
At their becoming hot I will set their banquets,
and I will make them drunk,
so that they will fall into a swoon,
and they will sleep ⸤an everlasting sleep⸥,\f + \fr 51:39 \ft Literally “a sleep of eternity” \f*
and they will not wake up,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 51:39 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh.
“I will bring them down like young rams to slaughter,
like rams and goats.
How Sheshach is captured,
and the glory of all the earth is seized!
How Babylon has become as an \add object of\add* horror
among the nations!
The sea has risen over Babylon,
she has been covered by the roar of its waves.
Her cities have become as an \add object of\add* horror,
a dry land and a wilderness,\f + \fr 51:43 \ft Or “Arabah” \f*
a land in which no person lives,
nor does a son of humankind pass through it.
And I will punish Bel in Babylon,
and I will wrench out from his mouth ⸤what he has swallowed⸥.\f + \fr 51:44 \ft Literally “what has been swallowed by him” \f*
And \add the\add* nations will not stream towards him \add any\add* longer
⸤what’s worse⸥,\f + \fr 51:44 \ft Literally “also” \f* the wall of Babylon has fallen.
Come out from her midst, my people,
and save each one his life
from ⸤the burning anger of⸥\f + \fr 51:45 \ft Literally “the blazing of the nose of” \f* Yahweh.
Now ⸤so that you are not fainthearted⸥,\f + \fr 51:46 \ft Literally “so that your heart is not timid” \f*
and you are afraid at the rumors\f + \fr 51:46 \ft Hebrew “rumor” \f* that are heard in the land—
and in the year the rumor comes,
and in the year after it the rumor,
and violence \add is\add* in the land,
with ruler against ruler—
⸤therefore⸥\f + \fr 51:47 \ft Literally “to thus” \f* look, days \add are\add* coming,
and I will punish the images of Babylon,
and all her land will be put to shame,
and all her slain ones will fall in the midst of her.
Then \add the\add* heaven and \add the\add* earth and all that \add is\add* in them
will shout for joy over Babylon,
for from \add the\add* north
the destroyers will come to it,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 51:48 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh.
Babylon must fall not only \add because of\add* the slain ones of Israel,
but also because of Babylon the slain ones of all the earth have fallen.
Survivors of \add the\add* sword, go!
You must not linger!
Remember Yahweh from far \add away\add*,
and let Jerusalem come to your ⸤mind⸥.\f + \fr 51:50 \ft Literally “heart” \f*
We are ashamed,
for we have heard taunts,\f + \fr 51:51 \ft Hebrew “taunt” \f*
disgrace covers our faces,
for strangers have come to the holy places of the house of Yahweh.
“⸤Therefore⸥\f + \fr 51:52 \ft Literally “To thus” \f* look, days \add are\add* coming,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 51:52 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh,
“and I will punish her images,
and \add the\add* fatally wounded will sigh through all her land.
Though Babylon goes up \add to\add* the heavens,
and though she fortifies the high place of her strength,
from me destroyers will come to her,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 51:53 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh.
\add The\add* sound of a cry for help from Babylon,
and a great collapse from the land of \add the\add* Chaldeans.
For Yahweh \add is\add* devastating Babylon,
and he obliterates \add her\add* loud noise\f + \fr 51:55 \ft Or “voice” \f* from her.
Their waves roar like mighty waters,
the roar of their voices\f + \fr 51:55 \ft Hebrew “voice” \f* resounds.
For a destroyer \add is\add* coming against her, against Babylon,
and her warriors are captured.
Their bows are broken;
for Yahweh \add is\add* a God of recompense,
certainly he will repay.
“And I will make drunk her officials, and her wise men,
her governors, and her officials, and her warriors,
and they will sleep ⸤an everlasting sleep⸥,\f + \fr 51:57 \ft Literally “a sleep of eternity” \f*
and they will not wake up,”
⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 51:57 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* the King, Yahweh of hosts \add is\add* his name.
Thus says Yahweh of hosts:
“The broad walls of Babylon will be utterly demolished,
and her high gates will burn with fire,
and \add the\add* peoples will labor ⸤for nothing⸥,\f + \fr 51:58 \ft Literally “for enough of empty” \f*
and \add the\add* nations ⸤for fire⸥,\f + \fr 51:58 \ft Literally “for enough of fire” \f*
and they will grow weary.”
The Scroll Concerning Babylon is Thrown into the Euphrates

The word that Jeremiah the prophet commanded Seraiah, the son of Neriah, the son of Mahseiah, at his going with Zedekiah, the king of Judah, \add to\add* Babylon in the fourth year of his reign. Now Seraiah \add was the\add* ⸤quartermaster⸥.\f + \fr 51:59 \ft Literally “official of \fq the \ft resting place” \f*
And Jeremiah wrote all the disasters\f + \fr 51:60 \ft Hebrew “disaster” \f* that would come on Babylon in one scroll, all these words that are written concerning Babylon.
And Jeremiah said to Seraiah, “At your coming \add to\add* Babylon, then you must see \add that\add* you read aloud all these words.

And you must say, ‘Yahweh, you yourself spoke against this place, to destroy it, so that \add there will\add* not be in it \add anything\add* living, from humankind to animals,\f + \fr 51:62 \ft Hebrew “animal” \f* for it will be ⸤an everlasting desolation⸥.’\f + \fr 51:62 \ft Literally “a desolation of eternity” \f*

⸤And then⸥\f + \fr 51:63 \ft Literally “And it will happen” \f* when you finish reading aloud this scroll, you must tie a stone on it, and you must throw it into the middle of \add the\add* Euphrates.

And you must say, ‘Babylon will sink, and she will not rise, ⸤because of⸥\f + \fr 51:64 \ft Literally “from” \f* the face of the disasters\f + \fr 51:64 \ft Hebrew “disaster” \f* that I \add am\add* bringing on her, and they will grow weary.’ ” ⸤Thus far⸥\f + \fr 51:64 \ft Literally “Up to here” \f* the words of Jeremiah.
